job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Oneonta, NY
pros: Kind and welcoming campus community, fun office environment, good pay
cons: I am not the biggest fan of things like college fairs or school events, the reason being I don’t like having to repeat the same thing over and over again to everyone I come into contact with. It is just tiring.

job_title: Chief Diversity Officer in Oneonta, NY
pros:
Committed to Positive Change
I have worked at Hartwick for almost a year as the Inaugural Chief Diversity Officer and I have found it to be a welcoming community seeking to genuinely engage diversity, equity and inclusion campus wide. DEI training I presented on “Generating Equitable Outcomes” was very well received by faculty and staff. Faculty training in inclusive pedagogy and antiracism have been well received. Hartwick is poised for positive change and I am excited about its future. Hartwick’s FlightPath program is used to equitably meet student’s needs and advance their individual academic goals forward. This is a great time to be in DEI leadership at Hartwick. Good people to work with and build friendships. I encourage you to add Hartwick to your list of places to work.
cons: Hartwick College is in the midst of a search to find a new President following the resignation of their long term retiring president. I sense great opportunity in the midst of change as the school builds on astute leadership hires over the years.

review_title: Find another school, this ship is sinking.
pros: It’s a paying job, that’s about it.
cons:
If you’re looking for a workplace filled with inexperienced Hartwick Alumni, look no further than Hartwick college. Each employee carries around a sense of pretentiousness as if this were an Ivy Leauge school when, in reality, they scrape the bottom of the barrel recruiting students. In this position, every employee I’ve talked to speaks in calculated heavily edited responses to try and confuse those they think are below them. In my time working here, outside of my office, I have not had an experience where someone hasn’t tried to talk down to me because of my position.

Have any valid criticism of the institution? The president sure does not want to hear it, getting offended that anyone would consider Hartwick to be a less than perfect place. 

If you’ve gone to Hartwick, congratulations, someone probably has an Assistant director position lined up for you already. 

Staff at this school really do try their hardest to pretend like this school isn’t a sinking ship, but I highly reccomend if you’re looking to work here, look somewhere else.

job_title: Title IX Coordinator/Compliance Officer in Oneonta, NY
pros: Hartwick is a great campus community in a beautiful location with diverse people (employees and students) with varying backgrounds, experiences, and beliefs, who are dedicated to the mission and values of the college.
cons: Higher education is changing with reductions in funding and rising costs across the country.  Smaller private liberal arts schools are working to provide greater value and support for students and remain affordable.  These are challenges that Hartwick is embracing and answering with new and creative approaches.  While tight budgets can be considered negative, I believe Hartwick is following a strong tradition of rising to a new level which will be greatly beneficial.

pros: Autonomy, smart colleagues, creative environment.  This is a beautiful campus with committed employees and I feel lucky to work here.
cons: To keep educational costs down there are many demands on a limited number of employees.  More to do in a day than can be accomplished.

review_title: A bunch of liberals duped by a dysfunctional dictatorship
